name: VSMPO-AVISMA
notes: World's largest Ti producer; pre-war capacity ~34000 MT/yr sponge; output dropped to ~17000 MT/yr post-2022; Boeing suspended purchases Mar 2022; Airbus phasing out; parent Rostec sanctioned; high geopolitical risk

name: TIMET (PCC/Berkshire Hathaway)
notes: ~13000 MT/yr sponge capacity at Henderson NV (idled since 2020); major mill products producer; owned by Precision Castparts/Berkshire Hathaway since 2012; supplies ~20% of world Ti; Ravenswood WV expansion underway

name: Toho Titanium
notes: 25200 MT/yr sponge capacity (Wakamatsu 15600 + Chigasaki 9600); expanding +3000 MT by 2026; Japan is #1 US sponge import source (67% of imports); aerospace-qualified; highly reliable

name: ATI Inc
notes: Major US Ti mill products producer; 80% capacity increase over FY2022 baseline by late 2025; Albany OR and Richland WA facilities; multi-year Airbus supply contract signed May 2025; no sponge production (melts purchased sponge)

name: Baoji Titanium Industry (BAOTI)
notes: 30000 MT/yr ingot capacity; 20000 MT/yr mill products; qualified by Boeing Airbus Rolls-Royce for non-critical parts; Chinese Ti generally not approved for critical aerospace structures in Western programs; low cost producer

name: Kobe Steel (KOBELCO)
notes: ~6000 MT/yr Ti products capacity; supplies Airbus A350 landing gear forgings; GE jet engine shafts via IHI; first Japanese supplier qualified by Rolls-Royce (2001); 2017 data falsification scandal affected trust; since remediated

name: Western Superconducting (WST)
notes: Major Chinese Ti alloy bar producer for aerospace; ~15000 MT/yr capacity; new 63/80-MN forging press from SMS group; primarily serves Chinese domestic aerospace (COMAC C919 J-36); limited Western aerospace qualification

name: Howmet Aerospace (RTI/Arconic)
notes: Formerly RTI International Metals; key Boeing 787 and Airbus A350 Ti supplier; produces sheets plates bars forgings; vertically integrated; strong aerospace qualification across major OEMs
